  <<<Analysis>>>
The code first imports the sys and collections modules.
The variable n is initialized to the integer value of the first line of input.
The function koch is defined, which takes three arguments: p1, p2, and n.
The function koch returns a list of points that form a Koch curve with the given parameters.
The main code then calls the koch function with the arguments [0.0,0.0],[100.0,0.0], and n, and joins the resulting list of points with newlines.
The resulting string is then printed.
